formula: If n is divisible by a prime == 2 mod 3 then a(n) = n(p+1)/(3p) where p is the smallest such prime divisor; otherwise if n is divisible by 3 then a(n) = n/3; otherwise all prime divisors of n are == 1 mod 3 and a(n) = (n-1)/3.
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{f = FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]]}, For[i = 1, i <= Length[f], i++, If[Mod[f[[i]], 3]==2, Return[n*(f[[i]] + 1)/3/f[[i]]]]]; If[Mod[n, 3] == 1, n-1, n]/3]
program: a211316 n | not $ null ps = n * (head ps + 1) `div` (3 * head ps)
where ps = [p | p <- a027748_row n, mod p 3 == 2]
(PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n)[,1]); for(i=1,#f, if(f[i]%3==2, return(n*(f[i]+1)/3/f[i]))); if(n%3, n-1, n)/3 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 02 2015
